attributes.action: Fulfill his 1997 manifesto pledge to bring in a form of proportional representation for General Elections.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
When the Labour Government was elected in 1997, one of their primary manifesto pledges stated: "We are committed to a referendum on the voting system for the House of Commons." 

In 1998 the Jenkins Commission  concluded that:

"The Commission's central recommendation is that the best alternative for Britain to the existing First Past The Post system is a two-vote mixed system which can be described as either limited AMS or AV Top-up. The majority of MPs (80 to 85%) would continue to be elected on an individual constituency basis, with the remainder elected on a corrective Top-up basis which would significantly reduce the disproportionality and the geographical divisiveness which are inherent in FPTP".

There are some good alternatives to pure PR which combine FPTP and PR to give a workable, more representative system.
